body.p: The stratum corneum consists of layers of dead cells. How can these dead cells help protect the living cells underneath?

multiple_choice.choice: They allow for osmosis to occur easily.
They are resistant to water penetration.
They allow diffusion to occur easily.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Osmosis is the movement of water, which is impaired in these cells.
Incorrect. The sweat glands and sebaceous glands secrete antimicrobial substances.
Correct. The keratin-filled cells act as a waterproof barrier.
Incorrect. Diffusion is the movement of molecules from an area of high concentration to an area of lower concentration. A layer of dead cells would interfere with diffusion.
